comment: I had Professor Morrissey for honors freshman seminar and she is so so kind and cares about her students the only downside is she can get a bit boring,but other than that participation easy A.

If taken as a summer course, LOTS of reading (about 4-8 hrswk, unless you're fast). The more you participate in discussions the better the experience. Sometimes her grading techniques seemed vague & based more on buzzwords. If you learn best through listening, great class. For those that learn best by reading, she doesn't do PPTs or give notes.

She was a good professor. She edited every rough draft and if you made her corrections and your paper was decent than you will get an A on it most likely. The final was easy just to revise one paper and i'm pretty sure everyone got a 98 on it if you did anything. Class can be very boring and drag on but for the most part it's a great class to take!

I loved Dr. Morrissey! We wrote 5 papers and would turn in certain parts before the final draft. She really teaches you how to write correctly for college. For the final, you choose one of your 5 papers and edit it again and write a one-page reflection on it. VERY EASY! If you try, I can't see how you wouldn't make an A. Books are required.
